meanings.definition: A person who encodes or decodes secret messages.
meanings.sent1: The cryptographers worked tirelessly to crack the coded message.
meanings.sent2: Many cryptographers are hired by governments to protect sensitive information.
meanings.sent3: The cryptographers had a secret competition to see who could decode the message first.
meanings.sent4: In the world of spies, cryptographers are the unsung heroes.
meanings.sent5: The cryptographers' skills were put to the test during the cyber attack.

meanings.definition: Those skilled in the science or study of cryptography.
meanings.sent1: We consulted with cryptographers to enhance our data security.
meanings.sent2: Cryptographers use complex algorithms to create secure communication channels.
meanings.sent3: The cryptographers' conference was full of intriguing discussions on encryption methods.
meanings.sent4: To the untrained eye, cryptographers seem like modern-day codebreakers.
meanings.sent5: The cryptographers' expertise was crucial in preventing the data breach.
